poem:
**Karaoke in the Eye of the Storm**

Typhoon's howl,  
glass-wrapped and brick-bound,  
mirrors songs  
within—  
Mayday's ballad  
warbling  
where winds whip,  
wild laughter breaking,  
among mic and echo.  
Voices rise  
like tides,  
Taipei sings  
its heart,  
storm and song  
twin spirits  
where only joy  
pierces the gale.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Karaoke and Kong-rey: Taiwan sings through biggest typhoon in decades The winds of typhoon Kong-rey howled through the streets of the Taiwanese capital, Taipei, on Thursday afternoon. Meanwhile, inside a brick and glass building people similarly wailed down the corridors of a branch of the Partyworld karaoke chain. Through the poorly soundproofed door of one room voices warbled a song by the Taiwanese rock band Mayday, and through another came the sounds of a song". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Karaoke and Kong-rey: Taiwan sings through biggest typhoon in decades The winds of typhoon Kong-rey howled through the streets of the Taiwanese capital, Taipei, on Thursday afternoon. Meanwhile, inside a brick and glass building people similarly wailed down the corridors of a branch of the Partyworld karaoke chain. Through the poorly soundproofed door of one room voices warbled a song by the Taiwanese rock band Mayday, and through another came the sounds of a song
